Governor Kathy Hochul warns of hazardous winter weather in New York, while the NYC area faces dense fog and air quality advisories; additionally, a former NYPD detective pleads guilty to fraud, and significant illegal cannabis seizures occur in Brooklyn and Rhinebeck.

### Risks & Alerts

- Gov. Kathy Hochul warns of hazardous winter weather across New York Wednesday. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
- NYC area is under dense fog and air quality advisories, with rain on the way. [↗](https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMinwFBVV95cUxNQW9XbEZuclpaR3ktb2NUNGFNQjNkWVdLV29OQ3hHSHZneVEyaHQyT1NBNWV2M1JmQ3JMZ3hxeW1TSlBNeXl4dllFN0ZLYU5JeXlRNU5IeU5BQXlMLUJtdVlCZElKZFIwTjZnN2c3UUtOT0c4X2FxbUdEZzFfZFFpcmY4SFpEbkVTeGdhV0JqeTFrMklOODhWVlBYSEJxdVk?oc=5)
- Traffic alert: Lanes closed on George Washington Bridge due to ongoing construction. [↗](https://news.google.?oc=5)
